Insists that Félix keep the change after a transaction, showing generosity.
Apologizes to Félix after insisting he keep the change, demonstrating politeness and sincerity.
Pays the vendor promptly and generously, insists he keep the change despite the small amount.
Hesitates when asking about the last stamp, showing caution and thoughtful negotiation.
Quickly checks her room when noticing it is slightly ajar, showing alertness and concern.
Bends down to check if Tex is alive, shows concern and attentiveness.
Urgently calls Mr. Bartholomew to report Tex’s death and accuse Adam, demonstrates trust and reliance on others.
Upon finding Tex's dead body, bends down to check if he is alive and observes the dying man's message to identify the killer.
Immediately calls Mr. Bartholomew to report the murder and clearly states her suspicions based on the clue left by Tex.
Focuses on crucial details (stamps on the letter) to solve a problem and promptly decides to leave for safety after receiving instructions.
Shudders briefly when looking at Tex's body but quickly resolves to act and escape danger.
Does not engage with Adam despite his attempts to stop her and communicate, instead runs away.
Notices the importance of the stamps on the envelope and uses this insight to act promptly.
Hangs up the phone and immediately takes action by leaving her room to pursue safety.
Chooses to take the stairs when the elevator is in use, showing presence of mind and quick decision-making.
Shudders when looking at Tex's body but nevertheless hurries to escape, demonstrating emotional control under stress.
Runs away from Adam after a warning, fearing for her life and showing distrust but motivated by self-preservation.
Attempts to communicate urgently with the taxi driver despite language barrier, showing initiative and calmness under pressure.
Runs decisively toward the exit and out of the hotel despite danger, immediately takes initiative to escape.
Attempts to take a taxi quickly but is unable to communicate effectively with the driver due to language barrier.
Recognizes threat and is quick to avoid Adam after he emerges from the hotel, switching to an alternate escape route via the Métro station.
Runs ahead of others in the metro station, crowding past them without hesitation.
Looks behind her frequently, showing concern or caution as she escapes.
Looks back anxiously for Adam, silently hopes for his safety, and watches the train doors carefully.
Looks around cautiously on the platform and considers options when the train arrives, showing presence of mind in a tense situation.
Hesitates briefly and seems unsure what to do as Adam runs off and the gate closes, indicating some uncertainty under pressure.
Hurries to find an exit upon being separated from Adam, showing concern and urgency.
Leaves Adam alone in the first-class car, moving quickly to try to escape but then is trapped behind a locked gate.
Hurries toward an exit to escape the situation promptly.
Fails to notice the exit is padlocked and is trapped just before escaping.
Quietly attempts to contact Mr. Bartholomew at the American Embassy despite difficulty, showing patience and persistence.
Attempts to make a difficult phone call at night from a phone booth, looking up numbers, and trying to contact someone important under uncertain conditions.
Speaks softly and unclearly into the phone, causing the operator to ask her to speak louder, and struggles to clearly communicate the name.
Calmly and clearly explains her dangerous situation to the operator, asking for help despite her fear.
Uses urgency and specific instructions to convey her predicament, showing trust in the operator to help.
Quietly observes and cautiously leaves the phone booth, carefully looking around to avoid danger.
Communicates an urgent and complex message clearly and quickly to the switchboard operator, gives specific instructions about location and situation.
Immediately takes initiative to make a second phone call after first fails to get direct help.
Exits a confined phone booth cautiously, observes surroundings carefully before proceeding.
Runs away from Adam despite his pleas and appearing tired, showing distrust and rejection.
Looks carefully for an exit before deciding which way to run.
Keeps running despite tiring and even after losing a shoe.
Runs away in a panic but manages to maintain balance and continue escape.
Rejects Adam's explanations without further inquiry.
Runs across a busy street ignoring traffic in urgent pursuit, waves stamps to get attention, clearly distressed and confused about whom to trust.
Stops long enough to kick off a shoe before running, shows quick adaptability in a stressful escape.
Runs across the street ignoring traffic, indicating impulsiveness rather than careful planning.
Waves stamps toward Bartholomew while running, attempting to communicate important information under pressure.
Stands exposed in the open between two armed men, confused and uncertain about whom to approach.
Shows confusion and hesitation between trusting two conflicting men, tries to understand their motives, takes a step toward ADAM.
Expresses distrust saying 'You lied to me so many times' but still engages in a sincere conversation.
Struggles with mistrust and uncertainty over whom to believe, showing vulnerability.
Is confused and unable to decide whom to trust between two conflicting men and hesitant in taking action, showing uncertainty.
Engages verbally with both men, tries to reason and assess their claims, showing some initiative to understand the situation.
Looks toward Adam for reassurance and slowly starts toward him despite threat.
Plea for time to think when threatened with violence.
Seeing CARSON otherwise occupied, she turns and runs toward the open stage door of the Comédie Française behind her, successfully evading danger.
Hides quietly in the prompter's box, holding her breath and avoiding detection.
Cringes back from the sudden bright light when the stage lights are turned on.
Ducks down out of sight to avoid being caught by Carson.
Remains hidden inside the prompter's box despite Carson's threats and warnings.
Does not attempt to escape or confront danger directly at this moment.
Slowly peers out of the prompter's box, climbs out, and runs to the open trap to look down at Carson's body, showing presence of mind and cautious investigation.
Unable to see the open trap from her low angle point of view initially.
Pulls back foot playfully but offers the other one for rubbing, showing control and light humor.
Questions Adam's motives, showing skepticism and critical thinking.
Insists Adam prove his honesty by telling her to go to the Embassy, demonstrating assertiveness and demand for evidence.
Decides to go to the Embassy by herself when Adam hesitates, showing initiative and independence.
Approaches the Marine at the Embassy and confidently asks for the correct contact regarding stolen government money, showing resourcefulness and poise.
Addresses the secretary politely and insists on being recognized as Mrs. Lampert.
Expresses frustration and accuses Adam of being mean, rotten, contemptible, and crooked.
Questions Adam’s honesty and motives, showing doubt but also engagement in the situation.
Approaches the embassy treasury office confidently, introduces herself properly, and gains access by speaking clearly and assertively.
Immediately recognizes the deception of Adam posing as Cruikshank and vocally confronts him, showing alertness and quick perception.
Expresses frustration by 'blowing up' emotionally but quickly tries to regain control of the situation by asking specific questions about Carson Dyle.
Insists on seeing identification before handing over stamps, challenging Cruikshank effectively.
Questions inconsistencies in Cruikshank's story, showing critical thinking.
Shows a momentary crestfallen reaction when told Cruikshank is not divorced, revealing slight emotional vulnerability.
Cheerfully expresses love and hopes for many children named after her partner.
Refuses to give up the stamps easily and plays along while trying to maintain control of the situation.
Momentarily confused by multiple names, showing some uncertainty.
Uses humor and flirtation to defuse tension and keep interaction engaging.
